instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.D6905: What is D6905? Diode sitting between PPBUS_G3H/PP18V5 charger voltage and PP3V42_G3H power supply input on very old Macbooks(before 2011), can die and cause PP3V42_G3H to be missing and have no input voltage. .
definitions.PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H: What is PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H? PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H is the input voltage to the PP3V42_G3H buck converter circuit, it can be either charger voltage or battery voltage depending on what the system power source is. This often shorts to ground when one of the input capacitors dies. .
definitions.C6990: What is C6990? Capacitor to ground on input to PP3V42_G3H power supply. PP3V42_G3H power supply turns 18.5v from charger or 8.5v-12.5v PPBUS_G3H from the battery into PP3V42_G3H. This capacitor can short to ground and keep PP3V42_G3H from turning on which would keep the machine from having a light on the magsafe charger.

threads.title: Liquid damage on 3023 Board
threads.message:
As soon as I plugged battery to Motherboard, Chip <CHIP>U6990</CHIP> at Pin 6 Sparked and chip dies 
Replaced Already <CHIP>U6900</CHIP> and <DIODE>D6905</DIODE> , but still Noticed Resisteance at <SIGNAL>PPVIN_G3H_P3V42G3H</SIGNAL> at Pin 6 is 100Ohm only
Removed capacitor <CAPACITOR>C6999</CAPACITOR> and <CAPACITOR>C6990</CAPACITOR> but still low resistance. 
Don't understand what should I try Next

threads.title: Liquid damage on 3023 Board
threads.message:
Didn't tell us what happens with charger only...

Did you check resistance to ground without <CHIP>U6990</CHIP>?
Also check it on L6995 too.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R6995</RESISTOR>/96 are both good.
